#summary Description of the behaviour of OpenCL kernel argument types

= Mapping OpenCL C types to JavaCL =

Here are the different kinds of values accepted as kernel arguments :

Primitive types :
|| OpenCL C type || JavaCL type || Description ||
|| int/uint || int || ||
|| long/ulong || long || ||
|| short/ushort || short || ||
|| char/uchar || byte || ||
|| float || float || ||
|| double || double || ||
|| size_t || NativeSize || ||

Vector types :
|| OpenCL C type || JavaCL type || Description ||
|| int2, int3, int4, int8... || int[] || ||

Array/Buffer types (including arrays of vector types ) :
|| OpenCL C type || JavaCL type || Description ||
|| __global int`*`<br/>__global uint`*`<br/>__global int2`*`<br/>... || CLIntBuffer (CLBuffer`<`IntBuffer`>`) || ||
|| __global long`*` || CLLongBuffer || ||
|| __global short`*` || CLShortBuffer || ||
|| __global char`*` || CLByteBuffer || ||
|| __global float`*` || CLFloatBuffer || ||
|| __global double`*` || CLDoubleBuffer || ||

Image-related types :
|| OpenCL C type || JavaCL type || Description ||
|| sampler_t || CLSampler || ||
|| image2d_t || CLImage2D || ||
|| image3d_t || CLImage3D || ||
